speaker: homer
dialog: He could not save his men.

speaker: homer
dialog: So the gods prevented them from ever reaching home.

speaker: homer
dialog: Tell me, O daughter of Jove.

speaker: neptune
dialog: Look at Aegisthus; he must needs make love.

speaker: minerva
dialog: Father, it served Aegisthus right. But Aegisthus is neither here nor there.

speaker: minerva
dialog: My heart bleeds, when I think of his sufferings.

speaker: jove
dialog: My child, what are you talking about?

speaker: minerva
dialog: The gods now mean that Ulysses should get home.
